thread.title: In Transit: A Religious Museum Reopens in Amsterdam
thread.title_full: In Transit: A Religious Museum Reopens in Amsterdam

author: DIANE DANIEL
title: In Transit: A Religious Museum Reopens in Amsterdam
text:
A Religious Museum Reopens in Amsterdam SEPT. 22, 2015 Our Lord in the Attic Museum. Credit Arjan Bronkhorst 
Advertisement Continue reading the main story The restored and expanded Our Lord in the Attic Museum (Museum Onsâ€™ Lieve Heer op Solder) in Amsterdam makes its debut on Sept. 23, when visitors will enter the museum through a new entrance building connected by underground passage to the 17th-century house. The six-year, $12 million project adds a museum shop and cafe as well as more exhibit space to cover themes such as religious freedom historically through modern times. In its new layout, the museum also focuses on the stories of the various people who lived in the house.
